sections.heading: Overview
content:
George Thomas Budd, MD, is a staff physician in the Taussig Cancer Center at
The Cleveland Clinic in Cleveland, Ohio. His clinical interests include breast
cancer, sarcomas, biologic response modifiers, experimental therapeutics, and
cancer chemoprevention.

Board-certified in internal medicine with a subspecialty in medical
oncology, Budd has authored more than 90 articles, book chapters, and
textbooks. He reviews for numerous peer-reviewed publications including the Journal of Clinical Oncology , Cancer and International Journal
of Cancer . In addition, Budd is a member of many professional societies,
including the American College of Physician, Society of Clinical Oncology, and
the American Association for Cancer Research. His research interests are
focused on cancer chemoprevention and experimental therapies for breast cancer
and sarcomas.

Budd received his medical degree from the University of Kansas Medical
School. He completed his internship, residency, and fellowship in hematology
and oncology at The Cleveland Clinic.
